summary.para: Retrieves data of the byte type from the pipe source.

param.name: buf
param.para: A pointer to the memory buffer that receives the data. The buffer must be able to hold at least the number of bytes specified in cRequest.

param.name: pcReturned
param.para: The actual number of bytes returned.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK to indicate that the data was retrieved successfully.

remarks.para: When the Pull method is called, data is requested from the provider of the pipe. The caller must provide a buffer that will hold at least the number of bytes specified in the cRequest parameter. The proxy will unmarshal the data into the provided buffer and set the number of bytes actually provided in pcReturned. The pcReturned parameter can be less than or equal to cRequest, but it will never be greater. When pcReturned is 0, it indicates that there is no more data.

summary.para: Sends data of the byte type to the pipe source.

param.name: buf
param.para: A pointer to the memory buffer that holds the data to be sent.

param.name: cSent
param.para: The number of bytes in the buffer.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK to indicate that the data was sent successfully.

remarks.para: When the Push method is called, the data is being sent to the provider of the pipe. The caller fills the buffer with the data and then calls Push. The number of bytes being sent is specified in the cSent parameter. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the buffer is valid for the duration of the call.
When the last of the data has been pushed, the caller must do one last push of cSent equal to 0 to indicate that the data transfer is complete.

summary.para: Transfers data of the byte type (which is 8 bits wide).
